definitions.text:
1. An instrument of music, the nature of trumpet, sounded by blowing with the mouth. It was of winding shape like horn; used armies and on occasions of joy.David played before the Lord on cornets. 2 Samuel 6:5.
2. In modern usage, an officer of cavalry, who bears the ensign colors of troop. He is the third officer the company.
3. A company of cavalry; troop of horse. [Not used.]
4. The cornet of horse [coronet[ is the lowest part of his pastern, that runs round the coffin and is distinguished by the hair that joins and covers the upper part of the hoof.
5. A little cap of paper which retailers inclose small wares.
6. A scarf anciently worn by doctors.
7. A head dress.
